note.p: Burial: Galilee chapel, Durham Cathedral, County Durham
Education: Wye School, Kent; Lincoln College, Oxford (matriculated 1668); MA (1683), DD (by diploma 1702); Middle Temple (admitted 1671)

Career: Travelled to France, Switzerland, Italy and Greece, and gave rare plants to John Ray (FRS 1667) and other botanists (1673-1676); ordained (c1683); Canon of Durham (1684); Vicar of Basingstoke, Hampshire (1685); built a chapel in Spitalfields, London, mainly at his own expense (1693); Rector of Winston, Co Durham (1706); Rector of Houghton-Le-Spring, Co Durham (1710-death); endowed a school for girls at Houghton-Le-Spring and gave his collection of antiquities and botanical specimens to Oxford University and his manuscripts and books to Lincoln College
